Package com.phunware.engagement Description

SDK for the Location Messaging platform from Phunware.

The main entry point of the Location Messaging SDK is the Engagement, which allows you to access the key components of the SDK:

  • LocationManager
  • MessageManager
  • AttributeManager

Initialization

The SDK is accessed through the static methods on the Engagement object, but before they can be accessed the SDK must be initialized. Initialization is performed through the Engagement.Builder object.

A standard workflow for initializing the Location Messaging service might look like: 


 public class MyApplication extends Application {
      @Override
     public void onCreate() {
         super.onCreate();

         // Create a Engagement instance
         Engagement lm = new Engagement.Builder(this)
             .brand("foo")
             .identifier("1234-5678-90ab-cdef")
             .environment(Environment.PROD)
             .build();

         // Configure a PwCoreSession and install the Engagement module.
         PwCoreSession.getInstance().registerKeys(this, "appId", "accessKey", "signatureKey",
                 "encryptionKey");
         PwCoreSession.getInstance().installModules(lm.asModule());
     }
 }
After the Engagement object has been initialized, you no longer need to keep a reference to it, you can simply use it's static methods to access the managers within.
